attributes.info: description of the credential object
name of the credential object

arguments.info: main definition parameter values in order of declaration

subblock.info:
Entities have a kind and a value.
  * The kind for a JSON value corresponds to the JSON type name ('string',
  'number', 'bool', 'null', 'array', 'object')
  * The kind for a resource declaration is 'declaration'
  * The kind for a resource collection is 'collection'

Entities have a kind and a value.
  * The value for entities of kind 'string', 'number', 'bool', 'null', 'array'
    or 'object' is the JSON reprensentation of the underlying value.
  * The value for a resource collection is a JSON object with the following keys:
      - 'namespace' contains a string representing the collection namespace (e.g. 'rs')
      - 'type' contains a string representing the collection type (e.g. 'servers')
      - 'hrefs' contains an arry of strings representing the hrefs of the resources in the collection
      - 'details' contains an array of hashes representing the resource attributes
  * The value for a resource declaration is a JSON object with the following keys:
      - 'namespace' contains a string representing the declaration namespace (e.g. 'rs')
      - 'type' contains a string reprensenting the declaration type (e.g. 'servers')
      - 'fields' contains a hash reprensenting the data needed to create the resource
      - 'dependencies' contains an array that lists names of references this declaration depends on

arguments.info: process source code, must contain a definition called 'main'

attributes.info: process execution error if any
process outputs if any
main definition parameter values in order of declaration

subblock.info:
Entities have a kind and a value.
  * The kind for a JSON value corresponds to the JSON type name ('string',
  'number', 'bool', 'null', 'array', 'object')
  * The kind for a resource declaration is 'declaration'
  * The kind for a resource collection is 'collection'

Entities have a kind and a value.
  * The value for entities of kind 'string', 'number', 'bool', 'null', 'array'
    or 'object' is the JSON reprensentation of the underlying value.
  * The value for a resource collection is a JSON object with the following keys:
      - 'namespace' contains a string representing the collection namespace (e.g. 'rs')
      - 'type' contains a string representing the collection type (e.g. 'servers')
      - 'hrefs' contains an arry of strings representing the hrefs of the resources in the collection
      - 'details' contains an array of hashes representing the resource attributes
  * The value for a resource declaration is a JSON object with the following keys:
      - 'namespace' contains a string representing the declaration namespace (e.g. 'rs')
      - 'type' contains a string reprensenting the declaration type (e.g. 'servers')
      - 'fields' contains a hash reprensenting the data needed to create the resource
      - 'dependencies' contains an array that lists names of references this declaration depends on

attributes.info: process source code, must contain a definition called 'main'
process status, one of "completed", "failed", "canceled" or "aborted"

arguments.info: Specify whether or not you want a public IP assigned when this Instance is launched. Only applies to Network-enabled Instances. If this is not specified, it will default to true.
The ID of the instance cloud
Cloud specific attributes that have no generic rightscale abstraction

subblock.info: The user that will be granted administrative privileges. Supported by AzureRM cloud only. For more information, review the documentation.
A flag indicating whether instance store mapping should be enabled. Not supported in all Clouds.
Availability set for raw instance. Supported by Azure v2 cloud only.
If enabled, the instance will launch into volume storage. Otherwise, it will boot to local storage.
Automatically create default port forwarding rules (enabled by default). Supported by Azure cloud only.
If enabled, the associated volume will be deleted when the instance is terminated.
The size of root disk. Supported by UCA cloud only.
Whether the instance is able to connect to IOPS-enabled volumes.
The name or ARN of the IAM Instance Profile (IIP) to associate with the instance (Amazon only)
The id of keep alive. Supported by UCA cloud only.
he ulr of keep alive. Supported by UCA cloud only.
Additional local SSDs. Supported by GCE cloud only
The type of SSD(s) to be created. Supported by GCE cloud only

Specify the max spot price you will pay for. Required when 'pricing_type' is 'spot'. Only applies to clouds which support spot-pricing and when 'spot' is chosen as the 'pricing_type'. Should be a Float value >= 0.001, eg: 0.095, 0.123, 1.23, etc...
The size of instance memory. Supported by UCA cloud only.
Extra data used for configuration, in query string format.
The number of instance cores. Supported by UCA cloud only.
The tenancy of the server you want to launch. A server with a tenancy of dedicated runs on single-tenant hardware and can only be launched into a VPC.
Launch a preemptible instance. A preemptible instance costs much less, but lasts only 24 hours. It can be terminated sooner due to system demands. Supported by GCE cloud only.

Specify whether or not you want to utilize 'fixed' (on-demand) or 'spot' pricing. Defaults to 'fixed' and only applies to clouds which support spot instances. Can only be set on when creating a new Instance, Server, or ServerArray, or when updating a Server or ServerArray's next_instance.WARNING: By using spot pricing, you acknowledge that your instance/server/array may not be able to be launched (and arrays may be unable to grow) as newly launched instances might be stuck in bidding, and/or existing instances may be terminated at any time, due to the cloud's spot pricing changes and availability.
The number of IOPS (I/O Operations Per Second) this root volume should support. Only available on clouds supporting performance provisioning.
The size for root disk. Not supported in all Clouds.
The type of root volume for instance. Only available on clouds supporting root volume type.
Email of service account for instance. Scope will default to cloud-platform. Supported by GCE cloud only.

arguments.info: The ID of the instance datacenter
The ID of the instance deployment
The ID of the instance image
Inputs associated with an instance when incarnated from a server or server array
The ID of the instance type
Allows this Instance to send and receive network traffic when the source and destination IP addresses do not match the IP address of this Instance.
The ID of the instance kernel image.
whether instance is locked, a locked instance cannot be terminated or deleted
The name of the instance
The placement group to launch the instance in. Not supported by all clouds & instance types.
The private ip address for the instance
The ID of the ramdisk image
The IDs of the security groups
The ID of the server template.
The ID of the SSH key to use
The IDs of the instance subnets
User data that RightScale automatically passes to your instance at boot time

arguments.info: An IP address range in CIDR notation. Required if source_type is 'cidr'. Conflicts with 'group_name' and 'group_owner'
Direction of traffic.  Options are 'ingress' or 'egress.'
Name of source Security Group. Required if source_type is 'group'.  Conflicts with 'cidr_ips'.
Owner of source Security Group. Required if source_type is 'group'. Conflicts with 'cidr_ips'.
Lower takes precedence. Supported by security group rules created in Microsoft Azure only.
Protocol to filter on.  Options are 'tcp', 'udp', 'icmp' and 'all'.

subblock.info: End of port range (inclusive). Required if protocol is 'tcp' or 'udp'.
ICMP code. Required if protocol is 'icmp'.
ICMP type. Required if protocol is 'icmp'.
Start of port range (inclusive). Required if protocol is 'tcp' or 'udp'.

arguments.info: The array type for the Server Array.

subblock.info: The href of the Datacenter / Zone.
Max instances (0 for unlimited).
Instance allocation (should total 100%).

arguments.info: ID of deployment in which to create server_array
description of server_array

subblock.info: Alert based server array params, required if 'array_type' is 'alert'
The percentage of servers that must agree in order to trigger an alert before an action is taken.
The Voters Tag that RightScale will use in order to determine when to scale up/down.
The maximum number of servers that can be operational at the same time in the server array.
The minimum number of servers that must be operational at all times in the server array.
The time (in minutes) on how long you want to wait before you repeat another action.
The number of servers to scale down by.
The number of servers to scale up by.
The audit SQS queue that will store audit entries.
The algorithm that defines how an item's age will be determined, either by the average age or max (oldest) age.
The threshold (in seconds) before a resize action occurs on the server array.
The regexp that helps the system determine an item's "age" in the queue. Example: created_at: (\d\d\d\d-\d\d-\d\d \d\d:\d\d:\d\d UTC)

Defines the ratio of worker instances per items in the queue. Example: If there are 50 items in the queue and "Items per instance" is set to 10, the server array will resize to 5 worker instances (50/10). Default = 1
Specifies the day when an alert-based array resizes.

The maximum number of servers that must be operational at all times in the server array. NOTE: Any changes that are made to the min/max count in the server array schedule will overwrite the array's default min/max count settings.

The minimum number of servers that must be operational at all times in the server array. NOTE: Any changes that are made to the min/max count in the server array schedule will overwrite the array's default min/max count settings.
Specifies the time when an alert-based array resizes.

The threshold (in seconds) before a resize action occurs on the server array.
The regexp that helps the system determine an item's "age" in the queue. Example: created_at: (\d\d\d\d-\d\d-\d\d \d\d:\d\d:\d\d UTC)

Defines the ratio of worker instances per items in the queue. Example: If there are 50 items in the queue and "Items per instance" is set to 10, the server array will resize to 5 worker instances (50/10). Default = 1
Specifies the day when an alert-based array resizes.

The maximum number of servers that must be operational at all times in the server array. NOTE: Any changes that are made to the min/max count in the server array schedule will overwrite the array's default min/max count settings.

The minimum number of servers that must be operational at all times in the server array. NOTE: Any changes that are made to the min/max count in the server array schedule will overwrite the array's default min/max count settings.
Specifies the time when an alert-based array resizes.

attributes.info: href of array
server array instance details

subblock.info: Specify whether or not you want a public IP assigned when this Instance is launched. Only applies to Network-enabled Instances. If this is not specified, it will default to true.
The ID of the instance cloud
Cloud specific attributes that have no generic rightscale abstraction
The user that will be granted administrative privileges. Supported by AzureRM cloud only. For more information, review the documentation.
A flag indicating whether instance store mapping should be enabled. Not supported in all Clouds.
Availability set for raw instance. Supported by Azure v2 cloud only.
If enabled, the instance will launch into volume storage. Otherwise, it will boot to local storage.
Automatically create default port forwarding rules (enabled by default). Supported by Azure cloud only.
If enabled, the associated volume will be deleted when the instance is terminated.
The size of root disk. Supported by UCA cloud only.
Whether the instance is able to connect to IOPS-enabled volumes.
The name or ARN of the IAM Instance Profile (IIP) to associate with the instance (Amazon only)
The id of keep alive. Supported by UCA cloud only.
he ulr of keep alive. Supported by UCA cloud only.
Additional local SSDs. Supported by GCE cloud only
The type of SSD(s) to be created. Supported by GCE cloud only

Specify the max spot price you will pay for. Required when 'pricing_type' is 'spot'. Only applies to clouds which support spot-pricing and when 'spot' is chosen as the 'pricing_type'. Should be a Float value >= 0.001, eg: 0.095, 0.123, 1.23, etc...
The size of instance memory. Supported by UCA cloud only.
Extra data used for configuration, in query string format.
The number of instance cores. Supported by UCA cloud only.
The tenancy of the server you want to launch. A server with a tenancy of dedicated runs on single-tenant hardware and can only be launched into a VPC.
Launch a preemptible instance. A preemptible instance costs much less, but lasts only 24 hours. It can be terminated sooner due to system demands. Supported by GCE cloud only.

Specify whether or not you want to utilize 'fixed' (on-demand) or 'spot' pricing. Defaults to 'fixed' and only applies to clouds which support spot instances. Can only be set on when creating a new Instance, Server, or ServerArray, or when updating a Server or ServerArray's next_instance.WARNING: By using spot pricing, you acknowledge that your instance/server/array may not be able to be launched (and arrays may be unable to grow) as newly launched instances might be stuck in bidding, and/or existing instances may be terminated at any time, due to the cloud's spot pricing changes and availability.
The number of IOPS (I/O Operations Per Second) this root volume should support. Only available on clouds supporting performance provisioning.
The size for root disk. Not supported in all Clouds.
The type of root volume for instance. Only available on clouds supporting root volume type.
Email of service account for instance. Scope will default to cloud-platform. Supported by GCE cloud only.
The ID of the instance datacenter
The ID of the instance deployment
The ID of the instance image
Inputs associated with an instance when incarnated from a server or server array
The ID of the instance type
Allows this Instance to send and receive network traffic when the source and destination IP addresses do not match the IP address of this Instance.
The ID of the instance kernel image.
whether instance is locked, a locked instance cannot be terminated or deleted
The name of the instance
The placement group to launch the instance in. Not supported by all clouds & instance types.
The private ip address for the instance
The ID of the ramdisk image
The IDs of the security groups
The ID of the server template.
The ID of the SSH key to use
The IDs of the instance subnets
User data that RightScale automatically passes to your instance at boot time

A flag indicating whether Instances of this ServerArray should be optimized for high-performance volumes (e.g. Volumes supporting a specified number of IOPS). Not supported in all Clouds.
The status of the server array. If active, the server array is enabled for scaling actions.
